title: Maine Voters Reject $950 Million Power Line for Hydro Imports
sub_head: Backers of project claim ballot vote was unconstitutional, and the builder plans a legal challenge
body:
Maine residents voted to reject a $950 million power transmission line under construction there to import Canadian hydropower, raising a hurdle for a long-pursued method of adding clean energy in New England.
The effect the vote will have on the 145-mile line wasn’t immediately clear. Avangrid Inc., the parent company of the line builder Central Maine Power, indicated it plans a legal challenge. Electricity customers in Massachusetts are paying for the line, and it is a key part of that state’s plan to curb emissions.
